synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blunt Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, along with their insightful guest Garrett, delve into the complexities of body image and the gym. They share personal experiences, challenge societal norms, and emphasize the importance of self-acceptance and finding joy in fitness, all while keeping the conversation light-hearted and relatable.
quotes: The horror is persistent, but so do we.
You have to be comfortable in your own skin to truly enjoy the gym.
Comparison is the thief of joy and progress.
If you’re going to the gym to improve your body image, make sure it’s for the right reasons.
Everyone has dealt with the same thoughts at some point in their lives.
Drink more water; it’s the simplest way to improve your mental and physical health.
You don’t have to go to the gym to get results; find something active that you enjoy.
Self-growth should be based around positive thoughts, not negative emotions.
People are attracted to confidence and authenticity, not just physical appearance.
Why would you put those thoughts in your head? That’s not realistic.
